ds.util
Class TNode<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.TNode<T>

public class TNode<T>
extends java.lang.Object

TNode objects are the elements in a binary tree; they have three fields that designate the value and links to the left and right child. The value (nodeValue) has a specified type and the two link fields left and right identify the left and right subtrees of the node.

A TNode object with both link fields null is a leaf node. A TNode object with at least one nonnull link field is an interior node.

TNode objects are the building blocks for binary tree structures. The data members are public.

See Also:
BinaryTree

 TNode<T> right

Constructor Summary
TNode(T item)
          Creates an instance with the specified value and with null link fields.
TNode(T item, TNode<T> left, TNode<T> right)
          Creates an instance with the specified value and with initial references for left and right.
